snippet: As Europeans and the United States considered cutting cash aid to Egypt, Saudi Arabia said that it and its allies would make up any reduction and vowed continued support.
abstract: Saudi Arabia emerges as foremost supporter of Egypt’s military rulers, explicitly backing violent crackdown on Islamists; is using its oil wealth and diplomatic muscle to help defy growing pressure from the West to end bloodshed in search of a political solution; as Europeans and United States consider cutting cash aid to Egypt, Saudi Arabia says it and its allies will make up any reduction,  effectively neutralizing the West’s main leverage over Cairo.

byline.contributor: Sarah Mousa contributed reporting from Cairo, Scott Sayare from Paris, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: As Europeans and the United States considered cutting cash aid to Egypt, Saudi Arabia said that it and its allies would make up any reduction and vowed continued support.

headline.main: Saudi Arabia Promises to Aid Egypt’s Regime
headline.print_headline: Saudi Arabia Promises to Aid Egypt’s Regime

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
